turns.raw_header: You used the tag `!<q>` before your message. I don’t have built‑in, official knowledge of that specific syntax as a standard command, but it looks like a custom or tool-specific prefix—possibly meaning “quote,” “question,” or a mode indicator.
turns.body:
Your content after it is just:

> test

If you’re experimenting: I can treat everything after `!<q>` as the actual message. In that case, I’ve received your test successfully and can respond normally.
turns.footer: If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a specific behavior (e.g., “answer briefly,” “treat as quote,” “special formatting”), tell me what it’s supposed to do and I’ll adapt to that convention.

parsed_footer.raw: If `!<q>` is meant to trigger a specific behavior (e.g., “answer briefly,” “treat as quote,” “special formatting”), tell me what it’s supposed to do and I’ll adapt to that convention.

turns.raw_header: I see the `!<o>` tag before your message:
turns.body:
> second test

Like `!<q>`, `!<o>` isn’t a standard command I inherently recognize. I’ll just treat everything after it as your actual message.
turns.footer: Your “second test” came through fine. If `!<o>` is meant to signal a particular behavior or format, tell me what it should mean and I’ll follow that convention.
